                Press Contacts                                                                                NYU News                                                Sherrilyn Ifill, NAACP Legal Defense Fund Leader and NYU Law Alum, to Speak at NYU’s Commencement           Apr 28, 2015    NYU President John Sexton and Board of Trustees Chairman Martin Lipton today announced the names of those to be honored at the University’s 183rd Commencement Exercises, which will be held Wednesday, May 20, 2015 in Yankee Stadium.    Read More           NYUToday-feature , Commencement , Student Life |   Press Release                                                                                                  Six NYU Faculty Awarded 2015 Guggenheim Fellowships     Six New York University professors and instructors have been awarded 2015 Guggenheim Fellowships, the John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation announced this week.    Read More                                                            CAS’s McLeod Named 2015 Truman Scholar     Krystal McLeod, a junior politics major in NYU’s College of Arts and Science, has been named a 2015 Truman Scholar—one of 58 Americans selected this year.    Read More                                                            Steinhardt’s Julia Wolfe Wins Pulitzer Prize for Music     Julia Wolfe, renowned composer and NYU Steinhardt associate professor of music, was awarded the 2015 Pulitzer Prize for Music for her composition "Anthracite Fields," a 45-minute multi-media oratorio about the plight of Pennsylvania coal miners.    Read More                                                                           Center for Ballet and the Arts Announces New Fellowship for Women Choreographers                     Apr 28, 2015          The Center for Ballet and the Arts at NYU announced the creation of the Virginia B. Toulmin Fellowship for Women Choreographers, a unique new fellowship designed to support the work of and expand the opportunities available to women in the world of ballet, where leadership and choreography are dominated by men.      Read More                 College of Arts and Science |     Press Release                                  Small High School Reform Boosts Districtwide Outcomes                     Apr 28, 2015          Creating small high schools improves outcomes for students in the overall school district – both in new small schools and existing larger schools – according to a study of New York City schools by researchers at NYU, Syracuse, and Arizona State University.      Read More                 Research , Faculty , Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development , Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service |     Press Release                                  Sherrilyn Ifill, NAACP Legal Defense Fund Leader and NYU Law Alum, to Speak at NYU’s Commencement                     Apr 28, 2015          NYU President John Sexton and Board of Trustees Chairman Martin Lipton today announced the names of those to be honored at the University’s 183rd Commencement Exercises, which will be held Wednesday, May 20, 2015 in Yankee Stadium.      Read More                 NYUToday-feature , Commencement , Student Life |     Press Release                                  ITP Spring Show, May 19-20                     Apr 27, 2015          The show that brought you the stop-and-frisk robot, the texting hoodie, and programmable friendship bracelets designed to teach girls to code, is back on May 19 and 20, when students at the NYU Tisch Interactive Telecommunications Program (ITP) will mount their annual interactive spring exhibition.      Read More                 Tisch School of the Arts |     Press Release                                  Steinhardt to Host an Evening with Julia Wolf                     Apr 24, 2015          Julia Wolfe - renowned composer, NYU Steinhardt associate professor of music, and recipient of the 2015 Pulitzer Prize - will come to NYU’s historic Provincetown Playhouse for a special evening of conversation and performances on Wednesday, April 29 at 7 p.m.      Read More                 Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development |     Press Release                                  Intimate Collaborations: Kandinsky & Münter, Arp & Taeuber– Apr. 24 @ 7 p.m.                     Apr 24, 2015          Deutsches Haus at NYU presents a lecture by Professor Bibiana Obler on her book Intimate Collaborations, which examines the work and lives of Expressionist artists.      Read More                 Around the Square , International Houses |     Press Release                                  “The Vietnam War Then and Now”—April 29-May 1 Conference, NYU’s DC Academic Center                     Apr 23, 2015          As the 40th anniversary of the end of the Vietnam War and the 50th anniversary of U.S escalation and anti-war protest arrives, NYU’s DC Academic Center will host a three-day conference, April 29-May 1, that will explore misconduct during the war and its impacts in Vietnam, diplomacy, the anti-war movement, and lessons for U.S. foreign policy.      Read More                 Washington DC , Events |     Press Release                                  Infants, Bicycles, and Lobsters: Conference Highlights Undergraduate Research—April 24                     Apr 22, 2015          NYU’s College of Arts and Science will host its 41st annual Undergraduate Research Conference on Friday, April 24, 9:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. at NYU’s Silver Center.      Read More                 College of Arts and Science , Events , Research |     Article                                  Tisch Filmmakers Awarded over $200,000 in Grants and Prizes                     Apr 22, 2015          Alumni and students from the Tisch film program were awarded over $200,000 in grants and prizes at the 73rd Annual First Run Film Festival Wasserman Awards, held Monday night at the Time Warner Center in Manhattan.      Read More                 Tisch School of the Arts |     Press Release                                  Conference Focuses on Equity in School Discipline Practices – May 22                     Apr 22, 2015          The Technical Assistance Center on Disproportionality will host its 2015 Summer Institute, “Creating Safe and Caring Schools: Improving School Discipline through Equitable and Responsive Practices.”      Read More                 Events , Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development |     Press Release                                  AAAS Elects Seven NYU Faculty as 2015 Fellows                     Apr 22, 2015          The American Academy of Arts and Sciences (AAAS) has elected seven New York University faculty as fellows.      Read More                 School of Law , Arts and Science , Research , Faculty |     Press Release                                  Thomas Sugrue Named Inaugural Carnegie Fellow                     Apr 22, 2015          Thomas Sugrue, who joins the NYU faculty as a professor in the Department of Social and Cultural Analysis this summer, has been named an Andrew Carnegie Fellow.      Read More                 Research , Arts and Science , Awards |     Press Release                                  Eating Insects – April 28                     Apr 21, 2015          Insects are nutritious, abundant on every continent, and – according to some – delicious. But why are...      Read More                 College of Arts and Science , Arts and Science , Events , Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development |     Press Release                                  NYU Wagner Presents “Improving Albany: A Path to Greater Effectiveness” – April 30                     Apr 21, 2015          To many observers, New York State government is in crisis, battered by a succession of scandals. A full-day conference at NYU Wagner asks, What can be done?      Read More                 Around the Square , Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service |     Press Release                                  NYU Professor Paul Light to Issue Report on Federal Government Reform and the Next Presidential Election – April 24                     Apr 21, 2015           “Americans may have found common ground in their dismal ratings of government performance,” Professor Light writes in a new report looking ahead to the 2016 presidential election, “but are now primed for a divisive fight over the appropriate fix.”      Read More                 Brademas Center , Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service |     Press Release                                       View All News in the Archive                   Video Spotlight                             Do the #NYUhappydance!                                                                  Midterms were stressful. Winter was stressful. Life is stressful. But dancing feels oh so good! Here's the first installment in our series of reminders that a smile and a little shake go a long way.              NYU Faculty News Brief                        Search News                                        Keywords:                          Select a School             Arts and Science         College of Arts and Science         College of Dentistry         College of Nursing         Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences         Division of Libraries         Gallatin School of Individualized Study         Graduate School of Arts and Science         Institute for the Study of the Ancient World         Institute of Fine Arts         Leonard N. Stern School of Business         Liberal Studies Program         NYU Abu Dhabi         NYU Shanghai         Polytechnic School of Engineering         Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service         School of Continuing and Professional Studies         School of Law         School of Medicine         Silver School of Social Work         Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development         Tisch School of the Arts                            Select a Topic             All University         Athletics         Awards         Division of Libraries         Events and Traditions         Institute of Fine Arts         International Houses         Research         nyu alumni magazine                       View articles from:          Through:             Advanced Search                                            NYU In the News   NYU Received a Record Number of Applications   Capital New York reported NYU received a record 60,322 applications for the class of 2019, an increase of about 15 percent since last year.     NYU Students Help City Crack Down on Hookah Bars   Capital New York reported that NYU students helped New York City crack down on hookah bars that illegally include tobacco in their hookahs:     Rudin Center Study Says Mass Transit Helps Economic Mobility   The Wall Street Journal wrote about a report by Wagner’s Rudin Center that showed that mass transit could be more important than education in determining economic mobility.     Brennan Center Report Says Campaign Spending Has Jumped   Frontline did a piece about a report by the Brennan Center for Justice that said that campaign spending by outside groups has more than doubled in the last five years.     NYU’s Dorms Ranked Among the Best in the Nation   Hometalk.com ranked NYU’s student residences third in the country in its list of best college dorms. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service         School of Continuing and Professional Studies         School of Law         School of Medicine         Silver School of Social Work         Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development         Tisch School of the Arts                            Select a Topic             All University         Athletics         Awards         Division of Libraries         Events and Traditions         Institute of Fine Arts         International Houses         Research         nyu alumni magazine                       View articles from:          Through:             Advanced Search                                            NYU In the News   NYU Received a Record Number of Applications   Capital New York reported NYU received a record 60,322 applications for the class of 2019, an increase of about 15 percent since last year.     NYU Students Help City Crack Down on Hookah Bars   Capital New York reported that NYU students helped New York City crack down on hookah bars that illegally include tobacco in their hookahs:     Rudin Center Study Says Mass Transit Helps Economic Mobility   The Wall Street Journal wrote about a report by Wagner’s Rudin Center that showed that mass transit could be more important than education in determining economic mobility.     Brennan Center Report Says Campaign Spending Has Jumped   Frontline did a piece about a report by the Brennan Center for Justice that said that campaign spending by outside groups has more than doubled in the last five years.     NYU’s Dorms Ranked Among the Best in the Nation   Hometalk.com ranked NYU’s student residences third in the country in its list of best college dorms.
